footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Ganyu | Update Date: 08/06/2022 | Editor: LordOfEnnui#8710

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Aqua Simulacra__
Best damage focused weapon. Ganyu's Elemental Burst snapshots its 20% DMG bonus when near enemies, so ranged on-field DPS' are not a problem.

__Elegy for the End__
Great for team compositions based on Reactions. Its Elemental Mastery and ATK% buffs are very helpful. The ER stat is great for her, as running ER sands may no longer be necessary in some teams. On others, it can be a loss for her personal DPS but is usually made up for by the gain in team DPS.

__Favonius Warbow__
Conditionally very good; as Ganyu gets CRIT Rate from many sources, getting its passive off can be consistent depending on the team composition, decreasing ER requirements and thus increasing potential team DPS. Note that it only activates when she is on-field.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon:
fields.value:
__Thundering Pulse__
Excellent weapon for sub-DPS capability. Its passive is largely wasted due to it providing Normal Attack DMG.

__Polar Star__
Conditionally excellent in comps that can fully or partially stack its passive by weaving a Charged Attack and/or a Normal Attack into Ganyu's rotation window (ie. N1CEQ) without it being a DPS loss. Will go over 100% CRIT Rate against Frozen enemies with 4pc Blizzard Strayer and Cryo Resonance, thus losing value.

__Skyward Harp__
Great unconditional damage option. The CRIT Rate stat is not ideal, as it raises the likelihood that Ganyu goes over 100% CRIT Rate with artifact substats against frozen enemies.

__Prototype Crescent R5__
Assuming she can take the time to hit a weakpoint, this bow is competitive with her 5* bows.

Mounn’s Moon, The Viridescent Hunt, The Stringless, Alley Hunter, Blackcliff Warbow are all very viable. Most DPS bows can be viable in comps that use some Charged Attacks.

**3)** Elemental Skill: Trail of the Qilin
